main-image-text: Sri Lanka, nestled in the Indian Ocean, boasts an astonishing array of wildlife, earning its reputation as a biodiversity hotspot. The island's diverse landscapes, ranging from lush rainforests to arid plains, harbor an impressive variety of species, many of which are endemic to this tropical paradise. Sri Lanka's wildlife showcases a magnificent tapestry of life, encompassing majestic mammals, vibrant birdlife, elusive reptiles, and fascinating marine creatures. This natural splendor attracts wildlife enthusiasts and nature lovers from across the globe, offering unforgettable encounters with the wonders of the natural world.
bio-title: The amazing biodiversity of Sri Lanka

bio-text.text: The species diversity of Sri Lanka shows that we have 4000 species of flowering plants, 107 species of freshwater fish, 59 species of amphibians, 174 species of reptiles, 435 species of birds, 140 species of mammals and several thousand invertebrates. Within the Asian region Sri Lanka has the highest species density for flowering plants, amphibians, reptiles and mammals. Sri Lanka also has the second highest population density of humans.

Sri Lanka, nestled in the Indian Ocean, boasts an awe-inspiring of biodiversity within its compact boundaries. Renowned as a biodiversity hotspot, this island nation harbors an astonishing variety of ecosystems, from lush rainforests to arid plains and coastal wetlands. This diverse landscape is the cradle for an array of endemic species, making it a paradise for nature enthusiasts and wildlife aficionados.
